metadata.title: CVE-2021-35613 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Cluster product of Oracle MySQL (component:Cluster: General). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.26 andprior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackerwith network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Cluster.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Cluster. CVSS3.1 Base Score 3.7 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
